huntYears.SEASON_DATE_TEXT: Archery Only: Aug 19-Aug 31, 2023 ALW: Sept 1, 2023 - Jan 15, 2024

huntMaster.SPECIAL_PROVISIONS: This permit is available as the Statewide Sportsman's Permit by applying for the permit in the late fall or by obtaining the Statewide Conservation Permit available to purchase through the approved conservation organization. See guidebook or contact a regional office for details.
huntMaster.NOTES:
Baiting big game for the purposes of hunting is now illegal in Utah.
Click here for more information.

The use of all trail cameras (including both non-handheld transmitting and non-transmitting devices) in the harvest or to aid in the harvest of big game is prohibited between July 31 and Dec. 31. Click here for more information.
huntMaster.HARVEST_REPORTING: REQUIRED: click here or call 1-800-221-0659 to report your harvest. You must report your harvest, even if you did not take an animal, within 30 days of the season end date that is printed on your permit; failure to do so may result in you not being able to apply for big game species in subsequent years. Submitting teeth or other biological samples from your animal, or having your animal checked by a DWR representative or CWMU operator does NOT fulfill your mandatory harvest reporting requirement.

huntBoundaryInfos.LAND_OWNERSHIP: The majority of land is managed by SITLA and DWR. There is a large DWR Wildlife Management Area (WMA) known as the Little Creek WMA. This area is managed for wildlife and the DWR encourages hunting on all WMA’s.
huntBoundaryInfos.CAMPGRND_INFO:
Suggested Maps: BLM: Vernal, West Water, and they have a general map that labels most of the main roads. 
DWR WMA’S: UDWR WMAs is limited to 14 days at one location.  
There are no established campgrounds in this unit, it is a first-come first-served basis.  Some hunters prefer to camp at the trailheads.  There are DWR cabins in this unit that are not for public use.  There is no camping allowed within a quarter mile of a DWR cabin.  

The trails are seasonally maintained by the DWR, and sportsmen.
huntBoundaryInfos.PRIM_ACCESS_PTS:
There are two trailheads for the roadless area, a north and a south.  The north access is called the Ten Mile Knoll trailhead.   If you take Utah State Road 88, it is located between Vernal and Roosevelt.  Follow SR 88 south and it turns into the Seep Ridge Road.  The Seep Ridge Rd splits and becomes the Divide Rd.  If you take the Divide Rd west the trail head is at the start of Steer Ridge.  There is a sign at the parking area.  It is a large parking area but it can fill up in a hurry with trucks and horse trailers.  The Hay Canyon Rd is the main access road on the south side of the Book Cliffs.  You can access it from I-70.  It is a hard packed dirt/gravel road.  The Steer Ridge Rd can be very dangerous if it has been snowing or raining but it can dry out quickly.

The south trail head starts at the top of Sego Canyon.  The road starts at Thompson Springs in Grand County and continues up the Sego Canyon Rd; follow it to the end of the road.  There is a water trough at the trailhead but it is not always full of water.  This trailhead can also fill up with vehicles and trailers.  There are no bathrooms or other facilities at either of these trailheads, so plan accordingly.
huntBoundaryInfos.SUGGESTED_MAPS: BLM: Vernal, West Water, and they have a general map that labels most of the main roads.  There are several county signs, and BLM signs to help direct you.
huntBoundaryInfos.ATV_VEH_ACCESS:
This area has strict travel constraints.  It is limited to horse and foot travel.  Sportsmen should take this into account before they put in for this unit.  The Steer Ridge Rd is one road that borders the northeast boundary of the unit.  There are no other roads around this unit.   

The Book Cliffs offers a challenging landscape.  There are large ridges with steep canyons dividing them.
huntBoundaryInfos.PRIV_TRIBE_LAND_ISSUES: The Ute Tribe as agreed to allow sportsmen to access this area across Ute Tribal trust lands.  Once you leave the Sego Trailhead parking area and start down the Went Ridge trail you are on Tribal land for the first few miles.  There are signs indicating that you have permission from the Tribe to use this route.  We ask that you please keep this area clean and stay on the main trail until you are off of Ute Tribal land.  This is a privilege and abuse of this area could lead to sportsmen losing this access permit.  This hunt excludes all Ute Tribal lands.
huntBoundaryInfos.BOUNDARY_DESCRIPTION: Grand County--Boundary begins at the Steer Ridge road at Ten Mile Knoll and the Book Cliffs summit (north-south drainage divide); southwest along the Book Cliffs summit on Diamond Ridge to the Uintah and Ouray Indian Reservation boundary (Hells Hole/head of Sego Canyon); north on this boundary (west side of West Willow Creek) to the DWR Wildlife Management Area/Ute Tribe Fence at the confluence of East and West Willow Creek; northeast from this confluence; cross-country to the Steer Ridge road (NW 1/4 Sec 7, T17S R21E); south and east on the Steer Ridge road (atop the drainage divide) to Ten Mile Knoll and the Book Cliffs summit. EXCLUDES ALL NATIVE AMERICAN TRUST LAND WITHIN THIS BOUNDARY. Excludes all CWMUs. USGS 1:100,000 Maps: Westwater. Boundary questions? Call Vernal office, 435-781-9453.

huntBoundaryInfos.CAMPGRND_INFO: All Campgrounds on this unit are managed by the US Forest Service and BLM.  Camping outside of official campgrounds is also permitted on most of the public lands.  Please direct all questions regarding campground availability and other camping questions to the US Forest Service.  Maps and camping regulations are available on their websites.
huntBoundaryInfos.COUNTY_ROAD_INFO: Most roads and ATV trails on this unit are managed by Box Elder County, the US Forest Service, or BLM and are covered on their Travel Management Plans.
huntBoundaryInfos.ATV_VEH_ACCESS:
Please direct all questions regarding which roads and trails ATVs can be operated on to the US Forest Service.
BLM: http://www.blm.gov/ut/st/en/fo/salt_lake.html
Sawtooth National Forest: http://www.fs.usda.gov/sawtooth/
Box Elder County: http://www.boxeldercounty.org/box-elder-county-web-map.htm
huntBoundaryInfos.PRIV_TRIBE_LAND_ISSUES: Hunters should receive written permission from private landowners prior to the start of the hunts if they wish to hunt private property.
huntBoundaryInfos.BOUNDARY_DESCRIPTION: Box Elder County--Boundary begins on the Utah-Idaho state line at SR-42; east on SR-42 to Curlew Junction and SR-30;  south and  west on SR-30 to the Utah-Nevada state line; north on this state line to the Utah-Idaho state line; west on this state line to SR-42. This hunt is comprised of all or largely private property. Hunters should acquire written permission from the landowner before applying for this hunt. Excludes all CWMUs. USGS 1:100,000 Maps: Grouse Creek, Jackpot, Newfoundland Mountains, Wells. Boundary Questions?  Call Ogden office, 801-476-2740.

huntBoundaryInfos.LAND_OWNERSHIP: Land ownership is primarily private.  Landowners will allow access, but will charge trespass fees to hunt their property.  Be prepared to pay $5,000 to $8,000 dollars to access private property.
huntBoundaryInfos.CAMPGRND_INFO:
Not vary many camping areas are available on the unit, but camping on the adjacent South Cache unit is available. See the Logan Ranger District website for info on camping.
http://www.fs.usda.gov/activity/uwcnf/recreation/camping-cabins
huntBoundaryInfos.PRIM_ACCESS_PTS: Round Valley, and Temple Canyon
huntBoundaryInfos.SUGGESTED_MAPS: http://wildlife.utah.gov/maps/public/details_boundary.php?boundary_id=33
huntBoundaryInfos.ATV_VEH_ACCESS: ATV access is limited.
huntBoundaryInfos.PRIV_TRIBE_LAND_ISSUES: Mostly private land.  Obtain written permission to access private property.
huntBoundaryInfos.BOUNDARY_DESCRIPTION: Rich County—Boundary begins at US-89 and the USFS boundary west of Garden City; south along this USFS boundary to SR-39; east on SR-39 to SR-16; north on SR-16 to SR-30; northwest on SR-30 to US-89; west on US-89 to the USFS boundary. USGS 1:100,000 Maps: Logan, Ogden. This hunt is comprised of all or largely private property. Hunters should acquire written permission from the landowner before applying for this hunt. Boundary questions? Call the Ogden office, 801-476-2740.

huntBoundaryInfos.LAND_OWNERSHIP: The North Cache unit is primarily Forest Service and State Institutional Trust land.  Some private inholdings are also found on the unit.  Most of the area where elk will be found is Forest Service Wilderness area and vehicle access is limited.
huntBoundaryInfos.CAMPGRND_INFO:
Campgrounds are administered by the Logan Ranger District. Contact there office or website for information.
http://www.fs.usda.gov/activity/uwcnf/recreation/camping-cabins
huntBoundaryInfos.PRIM_ACCESS_PTS: Best Access points are Tony Grove, Franklin Basin, and High Creek Canyon
huntBoundaryInfos.SUGGESTED_MAPS: http://wildlife.utah.gov/hunting-in-utah/hunt-boundary-maps.html
huntBoundaryInfos.COUNTY_ROAD_INFO: Roads access Tony Grove and Franklin Basin, but most of the unit is road less.
huntBoundaryInfos.ATV_VEH_ACCESS: ATV and vehicle access is limited to Tony Grove and Franklin Basin.
huntBoundaryInfos.PRIV_TRIBE_LAND_ISSUES: Some private land is found close to and in Franklin Basin as well as below Plymouth Peak.  Be sure you have written permission to access these lands.
huntBoundaryInfos.BOUNDARY_DESCRIPTION: Cache, Box Elder and Rich counties--Boundary begins at US-89 and the Utah-Idaho state line; southwest on US-89 to US 89/91 in Logan;  south on US 89/91 to SR-30; west on SR-30 to I-15 in Riverside; north on I-15 to the Utah-Idaho state line; east along this state line to US-89. USGS 1:100,000 Maps: Tremonton, Logan. Boundary questions? Call the Ogden office, 801-476-2740.

huntBoundaryInfos.LAND_OWNERSHIP: Land is primarily Forest Service, State Trust, and Division of Wildlife Resources land.  On the south end of the unit more private land in-holdings will be found.  Make sure you have permission to access private property.
huntBoundaryInfos.CAMPGRND_INFO:
See Logan Ranger District for camping on Forest Service Property.
http://www.fs.usda.gov/activity/uwcnf/recreation/camping-cabins
Camping on Hardware Ranch WMA is first come, first serve. Camping on the Ranch can be located along the Blacksmith Fork River, at upper Rock Creek and on Squaw Flat.
huntBoundaryInfos.PRIM_ACCESS_PTS: Blacksmith Fork, Temple Fork, Left Hand Fork, Right Hand Fork, Logan Canyon, Sinks Road, Temple Canyon, Monte Cristo, Currant Creek Guard Station, Old Canyon and Ant Flat.
huntBoundaryInfos.SUGGESTED_MAPS: http://wildlife.utah.gov/maps/public/details_boundary.php?boundary_id=41
huntBoundaryInfos.COUNTY_ROAD_INFO: Road access on the unit is good.  Roads access nearly all areas of the unit.
huntBoundaryInfos.ATV_VEH_ACCESS:
The Forest Service maintains travel plans for most of the unit see the Logan Ranger District website for more information on OHV use.
http://www.fs.usda.gov/activity/uwcnf/recreation/ohv
huntBoundaryInfos.PRIV_TRIBE_LAND_ISSUES: Be aware of private in-holdings on this unit especially on the south end around Hardware Ranch and Monte Cristo.  You should have written permission to access private property.
huntBoundaryInfos.BOUNDARY_DESCRIPTION: Cache, Rich and Weber counties—Boundary begins at US-89 and the USFS boundary west of Garden City; south on this boundary to SR-39; southwest on SR-39 to USFS Road 054 (Ant Flat road); north on this road to SR-101; west on SR-101 to US-89/91; north on US-89/91 to Logan and US-89; northeast on US-89 to the USFS boundary approximately 3 miles west of Garden City. USGS 1:100,000 Maps: Logan, Ogden. Boundary questions? Call the Ogden office, 801-476-2740.

huntBoundaryInfos.LAND_OWNERSHIP: Most of the summer and fall elk habitat is on public lands managed by the Forest Service.  There are however large tracts of private lands on the northeast portion of the unit in the area surrounding Scofield Reservoir.  Late Season Rifle hunters will have a little more private land to deal with as bulls transition to lower elevations.
huntBoundaryInfos.WMA_IN_UNIT: Gordon Creek, Lower Fish Creek, Starvation, Dairy Fork, Lake Fork, Birdseye, Lasson Draw, White Hill, Black Hill, Bald Mountain, Sixmile, Miller Manti Face, Nine Mile, Twelve Mile, Willow Creek.  Most of these properties are on winter range for elk.
huntBoundaryInfos.CAMPGRND_INFO: All Campgrounds on this unit are managed by the US Forest Service.  This unit is on the Manti La Sal National Forest.  Camping outside of official campgrounds is also permitted on most of the Forest. Please direct all questions regarding campground availability and other camping questions to the US Forest Service.  Maps and camping regulations are available on their websites at http://www.fs.usda.gov/mantilasal
huntBoundaryInfos.PRIM_ACCESS_PTS: The Upper Fish Creek trailhead can be found on the west side of Scofield Reservoir.  It travels west to the opposite trailhead on Skyline Drive near Johnson Ridge
huntBoundaryInfos.SUGGESTED_MAPS: 1:100,000 USGS maps include;  Price, Nephi, Huntington, Manti, Salina
huntBoundaryInfos.COUNTY_ROAD_INFO:
Most roads and ATV trails on this unit are managed by the US Forest Service and are covered on their Travel Management Plans.  Please direct all questions regarding which roads and trails ATVs can be operated on to the US Forest Service at http://www.fs.usda.gov/mantilasal

There are also several roads and ATV trails on land managed by the Utah Division of Wildlife Resources. All vehicles and ATV’s must stay on designated roads and trails on these lands.
huntBoundaryInfos.ATV_VEH_ACCESS: see above
huntBoundaryInfos.PRIV_TRIBE_LAND_ISSUES: There are no tribal lands to contend with. The vast majority of the early bull elk hunt habitat is on public land. A few exceptions include the following areas. The northeast portion of the mountain near Scofield Reservoir has a high percentage of private land on good elk habitat. Most of these lands are managed under the CWMU program and can not provide hunter access as your permit will not be valid on those properties. Other private properties require prior written permission before hunting. Small pockets of private lands at high elevations can be found surrounding Electric Lake and on East Mountain. Late Season any weapon hunters may encounter private lands in the Spring Canyon area west of Helper as well as upper Gordon Creek. Weather Conditions: The weather on this hunt unit can vary dramatically during the hunting season. Be prepared for rain, lightening, snow, wind and heat. It is quite common on clear mornings for clouds to build through the morning and have thunderstorms in the afternoon. Be very cautious of lightening while hunting on high ridges. Early fall snow storms occur regularly in this area. Most years the snow will melt off, within a day or two until the first week of October.
huntBoundaryInfos.BOUNDARY_DESCRIPTION: Carbon, Emery, Sanpete, Sevier and Utah counties—Boundary begins at the junction of US-6 and US-89 in Spanish Fork Canyon; southeast on US-6 to Price and SR-10; south on SR-10 to I-70; west on I-70 to US-89; north on US-89 to US-6 in Spanish Fork Canyon. USGS 1:100,000 Maps: Nephi, Price, Huntington, Manti, Salina. Boundary questions? Call the Springville office, 801-491-5678 or the Price office, 435-613-3700.

huntBoundaryInfos.LAND_OWNERSHIP: There is some private land on the north end in Robins valley.  The larger tracts of private land are found on the south end of the Pahvant and along winter range.  See map for details.  There is plenty of public land with large numbers of deer available to hunt.
huntBoundaryInfos.CAMPGRND_INFO: Established campgrounds are lower in elevation and can be found on the east side (Maple Grove) and on the west side (Maple Hollow - east of Holden; Meadow Creek - east of Meadow; Adelaide - East of Kanosh.  Many of these campgrounds are popular on weekends throughout the summer.
huntBoundaryInfos.PRIM_ACCESS_PTS:
East Side: Willow Creek (south of Scipio off of Hwy 50), Mountain roads (out of Joseph and Elsinore)

West Side: Kanosh Canyon Road out of Kanosh and Canyon Road out of Fillmore (Chalk Creek)
huntBoundaryInfos.SUGGESTED_MAPS: Fishlake National Forest
huntBoundaryInfos.ATV_VEH_ACCESS: There are several ATV trails, with most of them being on the southern half of the mountain
huntBoundaryInfos.PRIV_TRIBE_LAND_ISSUES: There is some private land on the north end in Robins valley.  The larger tracts of private land are found on the south end of the Pahvant and along winter range.  There is some tribal land found down low near Kanosh.  See map for details.  There is plenty of public land with large numbers of deer available to hunt.
huntBoundaryInfos.BOUNDARY_DESCRIPTION: Millard and Sevier counties—Boundary begins at I-70 and I-15; north on I-15 to US-50 at Scipio; southeast on US-50 to Salina and US-89; south on US-89 to I-70; southwest on I-70 to I-15. EXCLUDES ALL NATIVE AMERICAN TRUST LANDS WITHIN THIS BOUNDARY.  Excludes all CWMUs. USGS 1:100,000 Maps: Delta, Richfield, Salina. Boundary questions? Call the Cedar City office, 435-865-6100.

huntBoundaryInfos.LAND_OWNERSHIP: Public and private.  Public lands are primarily Bureau of Land Management (BLM) managed out of the Moab Field Office.  This unit is situated adjacent to the Colorado border, Utah hunting permits are not valid in Colorado.
huntBoundaryInfos.CAMPGRND_INFO:
There are no official camp sites on this unit. Camping is permitted on most of the BLM and SITLA lands. Please direct all questions regarding camping questions to SITLA or the BLM. Maps and camping regulations are available on their websites.
SITLA: http://trustlands.utah.gov/business-groups/surface/recreational-use-of-trust-lands/
BLM: http://www.blm.gov/ut/st/en/prog/recreation_home/activities/camping.html
huntBoundaryInfos.PRIM_ACCESS_PTS: Access is very limited.  Safest route is through Glade Park CO.  There is also access to the Dolores Triangle by crossing the Dolores River, but this route can be impassible depending on river conditions (use caution).
huntBoundaryInfos.SUGGESTED_MAPS: USGS 1:100,000 Maps: Moab, Westwater.
huntBoundaryInfos.ATV_VEH_ACCESS:
Most roads and ATV trails on this unit are managed by the Utah State Institutional Trust Lands and the Bureau of Land Management and are covered on their Travel Management Plans. Please direct all questions regarding which roads and trails ATVs can be operated on to SITLA or the BLM.
SITLA: http://trustlands.utah.gov/business-groups/surface/recreational-use-of-trust-lands/
BLM: http://www.blm.gov/ut/st/en/prog/recreation_home/activities/ohv_riding.html
huntBoundaryInfos.PRIV_TRIBE_LAND_ISSUES: There are some private lands on this subunit, hunters must receive written permission before hunting private lands.  Be sure to pay attention to where you are, and study maps before your hunt, please respect ALL posted lands.  The Colorado border is on the Eastern side of this unit, Utah hunting permits are not valid in Colorado.
huntBoundaryInfos.BOUNDARY_DESCRIPTION: Grand County--Boundary begins at the Colorado River and the Utah-Colorado state line; south on this state line to the Dolores River; northwest along this river to the Colorado River; northeast along this river to the Utah-Colorado state line. Excludes all CWMUs. USGS 1:100,000 Maps: Moab, Westwater. Boundary questions? Call Price office, 435-613-3700.

huntBoundaryInfos.LAND_OWNERSHIP: Approximately 65% public lands (BLM & USFS), 5%private and 30% tribal lands
huntBoundaryInfos.CAMPGRND_INFO:
There are no official campgrounds on this unit.  Camping outside of official campgrounds is permitted on most of the Forest. Please direct all questions regarding campground availability and other camping questions to the US Forest Service.  Maps and camping regulations are available on their websites. 
Anthro: http://www.fs.usda.gov/ashley
huntBoundaryInfos.ATV_VEH_ACCESS:
Most roads and ATV trails on this unit are managed by the US Forest Service and BLM and are covered on their Travel Management Plans. Please direct all questions regarding which roads and trails ATVs can be operated on to the US Forest Service and BLM.
Anthro: http://www.fs.usda.gov/ashley
http://www.blm.gov/ut/st/en/fo/vernal.html
huntBoundaryInfos.PRIV_TRIBE_LAND_ISSUES: The Anthro unit contains large amounts of Tribal Trust Lands. All ATVs are prohibited on Tribal Lands and must be trailered on access roads across Tribal Lands.  For information on which roads are legal access roads contact Duchesne County. There are also several large areas of private land on the unit, including 1 large CWMU. Hunters must receive written permission before hunting private lands.
huntBoundaryInfos.BOUNDARY_DESCRIPTION: Duchesne and Uintah counties—Boundary begins at US-191 and the Argyle Canyon Road; southeast on this road to the Nine Mile Canyon Road; east along this road to its end near Bulls Canyon; south from the end of this road to Nine Mile Creek; east along this creek to the Green River; north along this river to the BLM boundary near Pariette Draw; west along the BLM boundary to the Pleasant Valley Road (CR-31); west along this road to the Antelope Canyon Road (CR-27); south along this road to the Sowers Canyon Road (CR-24); south along this road to the Ute Tribal boundary; west along this boundary to the Cottonwood Ridge WMA boundary; west and north along this boundary to the Ute Tribal boundary; north and west along this road to US-191; south along US-191 to the Argyle Canyon Road. EXCLUDING ALL NATIVE AMERICAN TRUST LAND WITHIN THIS BOUNDARY. USGS 1:100,000 Maps: Duchesne, Price, Seep Ridge, Vernal. Boundary questions? Call the Vernal office, 435-781-9453.

huntBoundaryInfos.LAND_OWNERSHIP: 90% Public Land - US Forest Service lands, BLM, and State
huntBoundaryInfos.CAMPGRND_INFO:
All Campgrounds on this unit are managed by the US Forest Service and BLM. Camping outside of official campgrounds is also permitted on most of the public lands. Please direct all questions regarding campground availability and other camping questions to the US Forest Service. Maps and camping regulations are available on their websites.
Ashley National Forest: http://www.fs.usda.gov/main/ashley/home
huntBoundaryInfos.COUNTY_ROAD_INFO: County Road Access information: http://www.daggettcounty.org/index.aspx?nid=17 and http://www.utahcommuterlink.com/
huntBoundaryInfos.ATV_VEH_ACCESS:
Most roads and ATV trails on this unit are managed by the US Forest Service or BLM and are covered on their Travel Management Plans. Please direct all questions regarding which roads and trails ATVs can be operated on to the US Forest Service. There is no vehicle access allowed on Baretop.
Ashley National Forest: http://www.fs.usda.gov/detail/ashley/home/?cid=STELPRDB5432815
BLM: http://www.blm.gov/ut/st/en/fo/vernal.html
huntBoundaryInfos.PRIV_TRIBE_LAND_ISSUES: The boundary of this hunt unit does not include Tribal Trust Lands and does not have much private land included.  Hunters should receive written permission from private landowners prior to the start of the hunts if they wish to hunt private property.
huntBoundaryInfos.BOUNDARY_DESCRIPTION: Daggett County--Boundary begins at the Flaming Gorge Reservoir main channel western shoreline on the east side of Lucerne Point at the Utah-Wyoming state line; east on this state line to the Utah-Colorado state line; south on this state line to the Green River; west along this river to the Flaming Gorge Reservoir west shoreline; west along this shoreline to the Utah-Wyoming state line; east along the state line to Lucerne Point; east around Lucerne Point to the Utah-Wyoming State line. Excludes all CWMUs. USGS 1:100,000 Maps: Dutch John. Boundary questions? Call Vernal office, 435-781-9453.

huntBoundaryInfos.LAND_OWNERSHIP: Bears are found on both BLM public and private lands throughout the year
huntBoundaryInfos.CAMPGRND_INFO: There are no campgrounds in this portion of the unit, but the BLM has alot of dispersed camping locations along the roadways.
huntBoundaryInfos.PRIM_ACCESS_PTS: Tropic Reservoir road off of hwy 12, Glendale Bench, Hatch Bench
huntBoundaryInfos.SUGGESTED_MAPS: BLM and forest service travel maps
huntBoundaryInfos.ATV_VEH_ACCESS: Good access the unit for ATV's
huntBoundaryInfos.PRIV_TRIBE_LAND_ISSUES: Bryce Canyon National Park
huntBoundaryInfos.BOUNDARY_DESCRIPTION: Garfield and Kane counties—Boundary begins at US-89A and the Utah-Arizona state line; north on US-89A to US-89; north on US-89 to SR-12; east on SR-12 to the Paria River; south along the Paria River to the Utah-Arizona state line; west along this state line to US-89A. USGS 1:100,000 Maps: Kanab, Panguitch. Boundary questions? Call the Cedar City office, 435-865-6100.

huntBoundaryInfos.LAND_OWNERSHIP: The majority of the land within this unit is managed by federal and state land management agencies and thus open to hunting with general season permits but not Private Land Only permits. There are several large ranches within the unit, several of which are enrolled in the CWMU program for Big game. Consult accurate land ownership maps before going afield.
huntBoundaryInfos.CAMPGRND_INFO: <u>Campground information:</u> There are many improved Camping areas on the Fish Lake unit, both public and private. Good camping exists in Gooseberry area, Elk Horn, multiple areas around Fish Lake and Johnson Reservoir. Primitive camping is allowed on much of the BLM and USFS managed lands. There is one improved campground managed by the Piute tribe near Koosharem reservoir. During early spring some campgrounds are not accessible or open. Contact the managing agency for detailed information.
huntBoundaryInfos.PRIM_ACCESS_PTS: There are many ways to access this unit. During the winter and early spring many of these roads (especially the upper elevation sections) may be closed due to snow. The north end can be accessed off of I-70 at the Gooseberry exit and also at the Hwy 72 exit. There are also many smaller unimproved roads that get you into good country from the frontage road along I-70. Access to the eastern side of the unit is via hwy 72. Roads that fork from hwy 72 that get you into good county include the Last Chance road, Road #206 that gets you onto the Thousand Lake Mountain, road #036 that takes you past Mill Meadow Reservoir and to Fish Lake.  There are many ATV trails and smaller unimproved roads that fork off of Hwy 72. The main access on the south end is SR-25 to Fish Lake via SR-24.   The west side is accessed via several dirt roads including the Hancock Flat road off of SR-25,  Road #053 that forks off of SR-24 gets you into the Rex Reservoir, and the Lost Creek country.
huntBoundaryInfos.SUGGESTED_MAPS: USGS 1:100.000 Maps: Loa, Salina. Fish Lake National Forest Travel Map
huntBoundaryInfos.ATV_VEH_ACCESS: There is an expansive road and trail system on this unit. All roads and ATV trails on this unit are managed by the BLM, USFS, Sevier and Wayne counties. Most Travel regulations are covered in their Travel Management Plans.  Please direct questions regarding which roads and trails ATVs can be operated to the Fish Lake National Forest, Richfield and Loa offices. BLM offices are in Richfield and Loa. The USFS has a travel map that covers most of this area.
huntBoundaryInfos.PRIV_TRIBE_LAND_ISSUES: There are several large tracts of private property on this unit. Several of these tracts are enrolled in the CWMU program and require special permits to hunt on them. Consult a good map to ensure you know where you are and to avoid any trespass conflicts
huntBoundaryInfos.BOUNDARY_DESCRIPTION: Emery, Piute, Sevier and Wayne counties—Boundary begins at I-70 and SR-24 north of Sigurd; south and east on SR-24 to the Caineville Wash road; north on this road to the Cathedral Valley road; west on this road to Rock Springs Bench and the Last Chance Desert road; north on this road to the Blue Flats road; north and east on this road to the Willow Springs road; north on this road towards Windy Peak and the Windy Peak road; west on this road to SR-72; north on SR-72 to I-70; west on I-70 to SR-24 north of Sigurd. EXCLUDES ALL NATIONAL PARKS. USGS 1:100,000 Maps: Loa, Salina. Boundary questions? Call the Cedar City office, 435-865-6100.

huntBoundaryInfos.LAND_OWNERSHIP: Approximately 75% of summer and fall elk habitat is public land. Most land is administered by the US Forest Service, BLM and SILTLA.  There are tracts of private property, mainly near populated areas of the unit and near agricultural areas.
huntBoundaryInfos.CAMPGRND_INFO:
All Campgrounds on this subunit are managed by the US Forest Service, Utah State Institutional Trust Lands and the Bureau of Land Management. Camping outside of official campgrounds is also permitted on most of the Forest. Please direct all questions regarding campground availability and other camping questions to the US Forest Service, SITLA or the BLM. Maps and camping regulations are available on their websites.
USFS: http://www.fs.usda.gov/mantilasal
SITLA: http://trustlands.utah.gov/business-groups/surface/recreational-use-of-trust-lands/
BLM: http://www.blm.gov/ut/st/en/fo/monticello.html
huntBoundaryInfos.PRIM_ACCESS_PTS: North Cottonwood, South Cottonwood, Deer Flat, Robertson's Pasture, Blanding Mountain Rd., Monticello Mountain Rd.

huntBoundaryInfos.LAND_OWNERSHIP: 65% Public land-BLM and State lands.  35% Private lands enrolled in Diamond Mountain Landowner Association.

Please direct all questions regarding which roads and trails ATVs can be operated on to the US Forest Service. There is no off-road vehicle use allowed on DWR lands except on established roads and trails.
Ashley National Forest: http://www.fs.usda.gov/detail/ashley/home/?cid=STELPRDB5432815
BLM: http://www.blm.gov/ut/st/en/fo/vernal.html Most areas are closed to off road vehicle use except on designated routes.
huntBoundaryInfos.PRIV_TRIBE_LAND_ISSUES: The boundary of this hunt unit does not include Tribal Trust Lands, but does have private land included.  There is private property on Diamond Mountain.  You should receive written permission from the landowner before hunting on private property.
huntBoundaryInfos.BOUNDARY_DESCRIPTION: Daggett and Uintah counties--Boundary begins at the Utah-Colorado state line and the Green River at Browns Park; west along this river to Gorge Creek; south along Gorge Creek to the USFS/private land boundary at the head of Davenport Draw; south along the USFS/private land boundary on the west side of Davenport Draw to the BLM boundary; south along the BLM boundary approximately one-third of a mile to the rim of Diamond Mountain; south and easterly along this rim until the rim intersects the Diamond Mountain road (Jones Hole Road); south and west on this road to the Brush Creek road; south on this road to the Island Park/Rainbow Park road; east on this road to the Dinosaur National Monument boundary; north and east on this boundary to the Utah-Colorado state line; north on this state line to the Green River. Excludes all CWMUs. USGS 1:100,000 Maps: Dutch John. Boundary questions? Call Vernal office, 435-781-9453.

huntBoundaryInfos.LAND_OWNERSHIP: 75%-85% of summer and fall elk habitat is public land.

huntBoundaryInfos.COUNTY_ROAD_INFO:
PROJECT DESCRIPTION Central Federal Lands Highway Division (CFLHD), in partnership with Wasatch County, Utah County, and the United States Forest Service (USFS) is planning to improve Strawberry Sheep Creek Road, a 31.9 mile route between US-6 and US-40. This road is really 
ROAD CLOSURE CONSIDERATIONS The key objective is to construct these roadway improvements while minimizing impacts to public users. To facilitate public safety, certain segments of the road will be closed during various construction activities. When the road is open, delays up to 30 minutes can be expected. The construction schedule is subject to change. During road closures, no motorized vehicles will be permitted on the route. Adjacent Off Highway Vehicle (OHV) trail routes will continue to be open during road closures. Where a potential conflict between an OHV and construction equipment is possible, the OHV access will be restricted for public safety. Emergency access will be permitted at all times.
ROAD CLOSURE PRELIMINARY SCHEDULE
a combination of three smaller routes, Sheep Creek – Rays Valley Road (FR 70051); Unicorn Ridge – Indian Creek Road (FR 70042); and West Side Strawberry Road (FR 70131). The construction work will be split into four segments: Segment 1 (FR 70051) begins at the MP 0.0 (intersection with US-6) and ends at MP 7.0 (FR 70042). The work on Segment 1 consists of pavement rehabilitation including patching, crack sealing, and chip sealing. Segment 2 and Segment 3 (FR 70042) begins at MP 7.0 and ends at FR 70131. The work on Segment 2 and 3 consists of roadway bench widening, paving, drainage improvements, and safety improvements. Segment 4 (FR 70131) begins at the intersection with FR 70042 and ends 3.75 miles north of the intersection. The work on Segment 4 consists of pavement rehabilitation, pulverizing, and paving with subexcavation as needed.
QUESTIONS? Wasatch County Public Works 1891 West 3000 South Heber City, Utah 84032 435-654-1661 www.wasatch.utah.gov
Utah County
huntBoundaryInfos.ATV_VEH_ACCESS:
Most roads and ATV trails on this unit are managed by the US Forest Service and are covered on their Travel Management Plans. Please direct all questions regarding which roads and trails ATVs can be operated on to the US Forest Service.
Avintaquin: http://www.fs.usda.gov/ashley
Currant Creek: http://www.fs.usda.gov/uwcnf
Wasatch West: : http://www.fs.usda.gov/uwcnf
There are also several roads and ATV trails on land managed by the Utah Division of Wildlife Resources. All vehicles and ATV’s must stay on designated roads and trails on these lands.
huntBoundaryInfos.PRIV_TRIBE_LAND_ISSUES: Both the Currant Creek and Avintaquin subunits contain large amounts of Tribal Trust Lands. All ATVs are prohibited on Tribal Lands and must be trailered on access roads across Tribal Lands.  For information on which roads are legal access roads contact Duchesne County. There are also several large areas of private land on all subunits, including multiple CWMUs.  Hunters must receive written permission before hunting private lands. Limited-entry elk permits are not valid on elk CWMUs.
huntBoundaryInfos.BOUNDARY_DESCRIPTION: Carbon, Duchesne, Summit, Utah and Wasatch counties-Boundary begins at the junction of I-15 and 12300 south in Salt Lake; east on this road to 700 East; south on this road to Pioneer road: east on this road to Highland Drive; south on this road to Upper Corner Canyon Road; east on this road to the Salt Lake/Utah county line; east on this county line to the Salt Lake/Wasatch county line; northeast on this county line to the Wasatch/Summit county line; east on this county line to US-40; south on US-40 to SR-32; east on SR-32 to SR-35; southeast on SR-35 to SR-87; south on SR-87 to Duchesne and US-191; south on US-191 to US-6; northwest on US-6 to I-15; north on I-15 to 12300 south in Salt Lake City. EXCLUDING ALL NATIVE AMERICAN TRUST LAND WITHIN THIS BOUNDARY. USGS 1:100,000 Maps: Duchesne, Nephi, Price, Provo, Salt Lake City. Boundary questions? Call the Springville office, 801-491-5678.

huntBoundaryInfos.LAND_OWNERSHIP: The majority of land is managed by BLM and private ownership. The majority of the unit is a Wilderness Study Area administered by both Salt Lake and Filmore  BLM Field Offices. The southern and south east part of the Deep creek Mts. is Owned and control by Goshute Indian Reservation out of Ibapah, Utah.
huntBoundaryInfos.CAMPGRND_INFO: There are many dispersed camping sites within this unit. Bureau of Land Management: Please direct all questions regarding roads, maps and camping to the BLM Salt Lake Field Office https://www.blm.gov/office/salt-lake-field-office or (801) 320-8300
huntBoundaryInfos.PRIM_ACCESS_PTS: Granite, Delle, Tom's Creek Canyons

huntBoundaryInfos.BOUNDARY_DESCRIPTION: Juab and Tooele counties--Boundary begins at the Pleasant Valley road and the Utah-Nevada state line; north along this state line to the Salt Springs (Blue Lake) road; south on this road to the Pleasant Valley road; northwest on this road to the Utah-Nevada state line. EXCLUDES ALL NATIVE AMERICAN TRUST LAND WITHIN THIS BOUNDARY. Access is limited. USGS 1:100,000 Maps: Fish Springs, Wildcat Mountain. Boundary questions? Call the Springville office, 801-491-5678.

huntBoundaryInfos.LAND_OWNERSHIP: The majority of land is managed by the BLM.  There is a significant amount of SITLA land.  There are several DWR Wildlife Management Areas (WMA).  These areas are managed for wildlife and you can hunt on all these areas.
huntBoundaryInfos.WMA_IN_UNIT: Meadow Creek, Two Waters, Bitter Creek, Willow Creek, and Nash Wash WMAs.
huntBoundaryInfos.CAMPGRND_INFO:
Please direct all questions regarding maps and camping regulations to the Vernal BLM Field Office (http://www.blm.gov/ut/st/en/fo/vernal.html)
BLM:  14 day camping limit and you have to move 30 miles after 14 days. 
DWR WMA’S:  UDWR WMAs is limited to 14 days at one location.  On the Willow Creek WMA, camping is not allowed.  In the parcels that can be accessed by county roads there is no camping allowed.  Camping is only allowed in the parcels where the roads are closed, like Meadow Creek.
huntBoundaryInfos.PRIM_ACCESS_PTS: Seep Ridge Road (UT 88) and the Bonanza Highway/Atchee Ridge Road (UT 45) from the North, Hay Canyon from I-70 on the South
huntBoundaryInfos.SUGGESTED_MAPS: Suggested Maps: BLM: Vernal, West Water, and they have a general map that labels most of the main roads. There are several county signs and BLM signs to help direct you.
huntBoundaryInfos.ATV_VEH_ACCESS:
All roads and ATV trails on this unit are managed by the BLM, SITLA, and DWR, and regulations are covered in their Travel Management Plans. Please direct all questions regarding which roads and trails ATVs can be operated on to the Vernal BLM Field Office, and SITLA. The DWR WMA’s are restricted to ATV and vehicle travel on established roads and trails.

The Book Cliffs offers a challenging landscape. There are large ridges with steep canyons dividing them. Most of the canyons and ridges have roads or ATV trails to provide access. There are plenty of areas to hike and get away from the main roads. The hunting pressure will drastically decrease after opening weekend.

There are two roads that allow you to drive across the majority of the Book Cliffs. The Kings Well Rd starts at the Seep Ridge Rd on the west side, and it can take you all the way to the Dragon Rd on the east side. The Indian Ridge Road starts at the Seep Ridge Rd and goes through the bottom of Sweet Water, top of McCook Ridge, Bitter Creek, and to Big Park. It is a great road to locate wildlife during this time of year.

Interstate 70 will provide access to most of the drainages on the south side of the Book Cliffs. Wildlife are found often found in these canyons. Major canyons and access points include Thompson/Sego Canyon, Nash Wash, Cottonwood Canyon, Hay/Middle/East Canyons, and Bryson Canyon. There are roads that will take you to the top of the Book Cliffs only in Sego Canyon, Hay Canyon, East Canyon, and Bitter Creek. The remainder of the roads dead end a short way up the canyons.
huntBoundaryInfos.PRIV_TRIBE_LAND_ISSUES: The boundary excludes all of the Tribal Trust Lands.  There is a large area of Ute Tribal Trust land to the west of the hunt unit.  Road access across the Tribal land is permitted using county roads.  All ATVs are prohibited on Tribal Lands; they must be trailered on access roads across Tribal lands.
huntBoundaryInfos.BOUNDARY_DESCRIPTION: Grand and Uintah counties--Boundary begins at the Utah-Colorado state line and the White River; west along this river to the Green River; south along this river to Swasey’s Boat Ramp and the Hastings Road; south on this road to SR-19; south and east on SR-19 to Exit 164 on 1-70 near the town of Green River; east on I-70 to the Utah-Colorado state line; north on this state line to the White River. EXCLUDES THE BOOK CLIFFS, LITTLE CREEK ROADLESS UNIT. EXCLUDES ALL NATIVE AMERICAN TRUST LAND WITHIN THIS BOUNDARY. USGS 1:100,000 Maps: Huntington, Moab, Price, Seep Ridge, Vernal, Westwater. Boundary questions? Call the Vernal office, 435-781-9453 or the Price office, 435-613-3700. EXCLUDES Book Cliffs, Little Creek Roadless Unit as follows: Book Cliffs, Little Creek Roadless Grand County--Boundary begins at Steer Ridge road and Ten Mile Knoll; southwest along Diamond Ridge and the Book Cliffs summit (north-south drainage divide) to the Uintah and Ouray Indian Reservation boundary (Hells Hole/head of Sego Canyon); north along this boundary (west side of West Willow Creek) to the Wildlife Management Area/Ute Tribe Fence at the confluence of East and West Willow Creek; northeast to the west fork of the Steer Ridge road (NW 1/4 Sec 7, T17 S R 21 E); south and east along the Steer Ridge road (atop the drainage divide) to Ten Mile Knoll. EXCLUDES ALL NATIVE AMERICAN TRUST LAND WITHIN THIS BOUNDARY. USGS 1:100,000 Maps: Westwater. Boundary questions? Call the Vernal office, 435-781-9453.

huntBoundaryInfos.LAND_OWNERSHIP: BLM, USFS, SITLA with some private parcels scattered throughout the unit.

There is an expansive road and trail system on this unit. All roads and ATV trails on this unit are managed by the BLM and USFS. Most Travel regulations are covered in their Travel Management Plans.  Please direct questions regarding which roads and trails ATVs can be operated to the Fish Lake and Dixie National Forest, Richfield and Loa offices. BLM offices are in Richfield and Escalante. The USFS has a travel map that covers most of this area.

USGS 1:100,000 Maps: Escalante, Hite Crossing, Kanab, Loa, Navajo Mountain, Panguitch, Salina, Smokey Mountain. Boundary questions? Call the Cedar City office, 435-865-6100.

huntBoundaryInfos.LAND_OWNERSHIP: Public and Private, Check official map for information.
huntBoundaryInfos.WMA_IN_UNIT: All Wildlife Management Areas are open for this hunt except for the "Private Lands Only Hunt" for antlerless elk.
huntBoundaryInfos.CAMPGRND_INFO: Many improved and primitive camping opportunities on the unit.
huntBoundaryInfos.PRIM_ACCESS_PTS: The best access points are off the Nebo Loop Road. Forest Service gates are typically locked beginning in November until late April/early May. However there are many secondary canyon roads that offer access to good hunting. See following link to check seasonal road closures. <a href="https://www.fs.usda.gov/main/uwcnf/maps-pubs" target="_blank">https://www.fs.usda.gov/main/uwcnf/maps-pubs.

Please click here for more info or call the Spanish Fork Ranger District Office at 801-798-3571. Please Please be mindful of Wilderness Areas and associated regulations.
huntBoundaryInfos.BOUNDARY_DESCRIPTION: Juab, Millard, Sanpete, Sevier and Utah counties—Boundary begins at US-6 and I-15 at Spanish Fork; southeast on US-6 to US-89 near Thistle; south on US-89 to US-50 at Salina; northwest on US-50 to I-15 at Scipio; north on I-15 to US-6 at Spanish Fork. huntBoundaryInfos.LAND_OWNERSHIP: Public, Private and Parks Service.  The public lands are primarily US Forest Service lands managed by the Manti-La Sal National Forest and The Bureau of Land Management(BLM) managed out of the Moab Field Office.  This unit also includes National Parks Service lands that are closed to hunting.  The private lands are primarily on the Eastern portion of the unit, but there are private lands scattered throughout the unit. There are two CWMU's on the unit (Redd Ranches and JB Ranch).

All Campgrounds on this subunit are managed by the US Forest Service, Utah State Institutional Trust Lands and the Bureau of Land Management. Camping outside of official campgrounds is also permitted on most of the Forest. Please direct all questions regarding campground availability and other camping questions to the US Forest Service, SITLA or the BLM. Maps and camping regulations are available on their websites.

huntBoundaryInfos.LAND_OWNERSHIP: The majority of land is managed by USFS, BLM and private ownership. The northeast portion of the Oquirrh Mountains is privately owned (Rio Tinto-Kennecott) and is a CWMU. Hunters should become familiar with the property boundary.
huntBoundaryInfos.WMA_IN_UNIT: Pine Canyon and Walt Fitzgerald WMAs
huntBoundaryInfos.CAMPGRND_INFO:
There are many dispersed camping sites within this unit, and developed campgrounds in North and South Willow Canyons, Grantsville Reservoir, Middle Canyon, Settlement Canyon and Ophir Canyon.
Bureau of Land Management: Please direct all questions regarding roads, maps and camping to the BLM Salt Lake Field Office https://www.blm.gov/office/salt-lake-field-office or (801) 320-8300

Tooele County has information on county trails

http://www.tooelecountytrails.com/trails_map.html
huntBoundaryInfos.PRIV_TRIBE_LAND_ISSUES: All Tribal Lands are excluded from this hunt unit. The Skull Valley Goshute Tribe does not allow hunters across tribal lands to access Forest Service or BLM lands. Hunting on military lands (e.g. Tooele Army Depot North and South) is not permitted.
huntBoundaryInfos.BOUNDARY_DESCRIPTION: Salt Lake, Tooele and Utah counties--Boundary begins at I-15 and I-80 in Salt Lake City; south on I-15 to SR-73; west on SR-73 to Pony Express Road; west on this road to Faust Junction and SR-36; south on SR-36 to Pony Express Road; west on this road to the Skull Valley road; north on this road to I-80 at Rowley Junction; east on I-80 to I-15. The Pine Springs Conservation Wildlife Management Area is closed to motorized travel year-round. EXCLUDES ALL NATIVE AMERICAN TRUST LANDS WITHIN THIS BOUNDARY. Excludes all CWMUs. USGS 1:100,000 Maps: Provo, Rush Valley, Salt Lake City, Tooele. Boundary questions? Call the Springville office, (801) 491-5678.

huntBoundaryInfos.LAND_OWNERSHIP: Public, State Trust Lands (SITLA), Private and Utah Division of Wildlife Resources (DWR) Lands.  The public lands are Bureau of Land Management (BLM) managed out of the Cedar City Field Office.  This unit also includes over 10,000 acres of Division of Wildlife Resources land specifically for the benefit of wildlife and our sportsmen.  There is one CWMU on the unit (Zane) for pronghorn and one Landowners Association for elk.
huntBoundaryInfos.WMA_IN_UNIT: The Indian Peaks Wildlife Management area is good habitat for Elk and Deer.
huntBoundaryInfos.CAMPGRND_INFO: There are no official campgrounds on this unit. Please direct all questions regarding campground availability and other camping questions to the BLM. Cedar City and Fillmore BLM website: http://www.blm.gov/ut/st/en/fo/cedar_city/recreation.html http://www.blm.gov/ut/st/en/fo/fillmore/recreation.html
huntBoundaryInfos.SUGGESTED_MAPS: BLM 1:100,000 maps Cedar City, South Wah Wah, North Wah Wah
huntBoundaryInfos.PRIV_TRIBE_LAND_ISSUES: Private landowners have had several issues with trespass by hunters in recent years. Please respect private property, fences, livestock presence and close gates.  County Sheriffs Deputies and DWR wildlife officers will be out patrolling during the hunting seasons.
huntBoundaryInfos.BOUNDARY_DESCRIPTION: Beaver, Iron and Millard counties—Boundary begins at the Utah-Nevada state line and US-6/50; east on US-6/50 to SR-257; south on SR-257 to SR-21; south on SR-21 to SR-130; south on SR-130 to I-15; south on I-15 to SR-56; west on SR-56 to the Lund highway; northwest on this highway to Lund and the Union Pacific railroad tracks; southwest along these tracks to the Utah-Nevada state line; north on this state line to US-6/50. Excludes all CWMUs. USGS 1:100,000 Maps: Beaver, Caliente, Cedar City, Delta, Garrison, Richfield, Tule Valley, Wah Wah Mountains North, Wah Wah Mountains South, Wilson Creek Range. Boundary questions? Call the Cedar City office, 435-865-6100.

huntBoundaryInfos.LAND_OWNERSHIP: Public, Private and Tribal Lands.  Public lands include lands managed by the BLM, USFS (Fish Lake National Forest), and the state of Utah.  Most of the mountainous ground is public land and open to the public. There are both large and small tracts of privately owned property scattered both in the low country and high country. In addition there is a small parcel of tribal land adjacent to Koosharem reservoir
huntBoundaryInfos.WMA_IN_UNIT: Elbow Ranch WMA - The Elbow Ranch WMA is a large winter range area. Do not expect high numbers of big game or bears to use this area during most hunting seasons.
huntBoundaryInfos.CAMPGRND_INFO: There is only one official campground located on the unit. This campground is owned by the Koosharem Band of Piutes and is located adjacent to Koosharem reservoir. Hotel/camping accommodations exist in cities and towns that surround the unit. There is also a nearby campground at Otter Creek State Park. Camping outside of official campgrounds is permitted on most public ground. Please direct camping questions to the appropriate land management agency. Fishlake National Forest website: http://www.fs.usda.gov/fishlake
huntBoundaryInfos.PRIM_ACCESS_PTS: There are several main access roads to the Monroe unit. You can access the north side via road #068 from either the town of Annabella or Glenwood. This is a well maintained gravel road. From the east side you can take road #076 out of Koosharem and #069 out of Greenwich. Road #069 is the best road to take if you are pulling camp a trailer. The south end of the mountain can be accessed with the Pole canyon road (#072) near Angle or the Monroe Mountain road (#068) near Kingston. Both of these are maintained but are rather narrow and not recommended for large trailers. To access the west side of the unit use the Dry Creek road (#071) or the Monroe Canyon road (#078). Both of these roads are not recommended for trailers.
huntBoundaryInfos.SUGGESTED_MAPS: USGS 1:100,000 Maps: Beaver, Loa, Richfield, Salina.  USFS Travel Management map
huntBoundaryInfos.ATV_VEH_ACCESS: ATV and Vehicle Access: The Monroe unit has an extensive road and trail system. Many good areas to hunt can be accessed via vehicle. During the early hunting seasons most all roads and trails can be accessed. During later seasons early and heavy snows may make travel difficult. Some trails are restricted to ATVs of a certain size only. Most roads and ATV trails on this unit are managed by the US Forest Service and are covered on their Travel Management Plans. Please direct all questions regarding which roads and trails ATVs can be operated on to the US Forest Service. Maps can also be purchased online at: http://www.fs.usda.gov/main/fishlake/maps-pubs
huntBoundaryInfos.PRIV_TRIBE_LAND_ISSUES: There are both large and small tracts of privately owned property scattered both in the low elevation and high areas. In addition there is a small parcel of tribal land adjacent to Koosharem reservoir. Please respect all private lands and associated trespass laws.
huntBoundaryInfos.BOUNDARY_DESCRIPTION: Piute and Sevier counties—Boundary begins at US-89 and I-70 near Sevier; south on US-89 to SR-62; east and north on SR-62 to SR-24; north on SR-24 to I-70; south on I-70 to US-89 near Sevier. EXCLUDES ALL NATIVE AMERICAN TRUST LANDS WITHIN THIS BOUNDARY. USGS 1:100,000 Maps: Beaver, Loa, Richfield, Salina. Boundary questions? Call the Cedar City office, 435-865-6100.

huntBoundaryInfos.LAND_OWNERSHIP: Forest Service, BLM, State, Private
huntBoundaryInfos.WMA_IN_UNIT: Kingston Canyon WMA is on the north end and has sportsman access, but it is all on foot.
huntBoundaryInfos.CAMPGRND_INFO: No campgrounds are located on the unit but dispersed camping is available.
huntBoundaryInfos.PRIM_ACCESS_PTS: You can access the south end of the unit from the Tom Best Spring road off of HWY 12. You can access the east side of the unit on several different access point along SR-22 (John's Valley Highway). The north end of the unit is inaccessible except by foot. The west side of the unit can be accessed by several points from Circleville to Panguitch along HWY 89. I would access the top of the mountain using the Jones Corral or Cottonwood loop road.
huntBoundaryInfos.SUGGESTED_MAPS: USFS, and BLM land maps.
huntBoundaryInfos.ATV_VEH_ACCESS: ATV's are a good way to access the units. Several roads are impassible by vehicle so an ATV would be recommended.
huntBoundaryInfos.BOUNDARY_DESCRIPTION: Garfield and Piute counties—Boundary begins at US-89 and SR-62; south on US-89 to SR-12; east on SR-12 to the Widtsoe-Antimony Road; north on this road to SR-22; north on SR-22 to SR-62; west on SR-62 to US-89. Excludes all CWMUs. USGS 1:100,000 Maps: Beaver, Escalante, Loa, Panguitch. Boundary questions? Call the Cedar City office, 435-865-6100.

huntBoundaryInfos.LAND_OWNERSHIP: USFS, BLM, Private, SITLA
huntBoundaryInfos.CAMPGRND_INFO: Please direct all questions regarding maps and camping regulations to the Cedar City and Kanab BLM Field Offices or Dixie National Forest in Cedar City.
huntBoundaryInfos.PRIM_ACCESS_PTS: Bear Valley on hwy 20. Also several Forest Service and BLM access roads off of highway 143 between Cedar Breaks and Panguitch.
huntBoundaryInfos.SUGGESTED_MAPS: BLM; Cedar City, Panguitch - USFS; Cedar City Ranger District
huntBoundaryInfos.ATV_VEH_ACCESS: All roads and ATV trails on this unit are managed by the BLM, SITLA, and USFS and regulations are covered in their Travel Management Plans.  Please direct all questions regarding which roads and trails ATVs can be operated on to the Cedar City and Kanab BLM Field Offices, the Dixie National Forest in Cedar City, and SITLA.
huntBoundaryInfos.BOUNDARY_DESCRIPTION: Garfield, Iron and Kane counties—Boundary begins at US-89 and SR-14; north on US-89 to SR-20; west on SR-20 to I-15; south on I-15 to SR-14; east on SR-14 to US-89. USGS 1:100,000 Maps: Beaver, Cedar City, Panguitch. Boundary questions? Call the Cedar City office, 435-865-6100.

Box Elder and Tooele counties--Boundary begins at SR-30 and the Utah-Nevada state line; east on SR-30 to the township line separating Range 15 West and Range 16 West; south along this township line to I-80; then west on I-80 to the Utah-Nevada state line; north on this state line to SR-30. Hunters with this permit may hunt Nevada’s portion of this interstate unit (091) and abide by Nevada laws. USGS 1:100,000 Maps: Newfoundland Mtns, Bonneville Salt Flats, Wells, Wendover. Boundary questions? Call the Ogden office, 801-476-2740.
huntBoundaryInfos.BOUNDARY_NAME: Box Elder, Pilot Mtn (rocky mountain bighorn)

huntBoundaryInfos.CAMPGRND_INFO: See map,  there are several established campgrounds off of Highway 153 out of Beaver.  There are also many pull off camping areas across the range.
huntBoundaryInfos.PRIM_ACCESS_PTS:
Big Johns Flat- Plenty of Access and camping
Big Flat- Plenty of access and camping
Kents Lake- Popular camping area must hike off the road to get away from people
Rainbow Mine- Limited road access
Cottonwood Creek- limited road access
City Creek Peak- limited road access, popular area
Lebaron Reservoir- limited road access, popular area
Mumford Reservoir– Limited access, steep areas
Bakers Canyon- popular area
Briggs Ridge– remote hunting area, steep terrain
Shingle Creek Meadows- Some ATV trails and remote hunting opportunities.
North Creek– Limited Access
Manderfield- gravel roads, a little flatter area, be aware of private Property
huntBoundaryInfos.SUGGESTED_MAPS: Fishlake National Forest - Beaver and Fillmore Ranger Districts
huntBoundaryInfos.ATV_VEH_ACCESS: Most roads and ATV trails on this unit are managed by the US Forest Service and are covered on their Travel Management Plans. Please direct all questions regarding which roads and trails ATVs can be operated on to the US Forest Service. Maps can also be purchased online at: http://www.fs.usda.gov/main/fishlake/maps-pubs
huntBoundaryInfos.BOUNDARY_DESCRIPTION: Beaver, Garfield, Iron, Millard, Piute and Sevier counties--Boundary begins at I-15 and I-70; east on I-70 to US-89; south on US-89 to SR-20; west on SR-20 to I-15; north on I-15 to I-70. Excludes all CWMUs. USGS 1:100,000 Maps: Beaver, Panguitch, Richfield. Boundary questions? Call Cedar City office, 435-865-6100.
